alert.note: Alert for Coastal Ocean (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Rip Current Statement issued October 01 at 5:08AM EDT until October 01 at 8:00PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...COASTAL FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 2 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... ...HIGH RIP CURRENT RISK REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH THIS EVENING... * WHAT...For the High Rip Current Risk, dangerous rip currents will occur. For the Coastal Flood Advisory, up to one foot of inundation above ground level in low-lying areas near shorelines and tidal waterways. * WHERE...The coast of Ocean County, New Jersey. * WHEN...For the High Rip Current Risk, through this evening. For the Coastal Flood Advisory, until 2:00 PM this afternoon. * IMPACTS...At this level, flooding begins on the most vulnerable roads in coastal and bayside communities, and along inland tidal waterways. Some partial or full road closures are possible. Rip currents can sweep even the best swimmers away from shore and into deeper water. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Tidal departures and the astronomical high tide levels will be on the decrease during the new week. While some spotty minor tidal flooding remains possible on Monday, it should not be impactful enough to warrant another Coastal Flood Advisory. Time of high total tides are approximate to the nearest hour. Barnegat Bay at Barnegat Light MLLW Categories - Minor 3.5 ft, Moderate 4.5 ft, Major 5.5 ft MHHW Categories - Minor 1.0 ft, Moderate 2.0 ft, Major 3.0 ft Total Total Departure Day/Time Tide Tide from Norm Flood ft MLLW ft MHHW ft Impact -------- --------- --------- --------- -------- 01/09 AM 4.0 1.5 0.9 Minor 01/10 PM 3.2 0.7 0.5 None 02/10 AM 3.5 1.0 0.4 Minor 02/11 PM 2.9 0.4 0.4 None 03/11 AM 3.4 0.9 0.4 None 04/12 AM 2.6 0.1 0.3 None &&
info.instruction: If travel is required, allow extra time as some roads may be closed. Do not drive around barricades or through water of unknown depth. Take the necessary actions to protect flood-prone property. Do not enter the surf.
